name: undomesticated
content:
undomesticated adjective
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able or willing to do cleaning, cooking, and other jobs in the home, and to take care of children: I'm always clean, with clean clothes, but I'm terribly undomesticated. He never cooks or cleans, and is totally undomesticated.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was criticized for her undomesticated ways, and was constantly termed "a strange child".

undomesticated adjective
(ANIMAL)
(of an animal) not brought under human control in order to provide food, power, or company: Undomesticated dogs, like many other wild animals, do not expect to eat according to a rigid schedule. When you compare undomesticated cats with undomesticated dogs, I would be a lot more nervous in a cage with a lion or tiger than a wolf or jackal. Compare
feral
wild
More examplesFewer examplesShe'd spent the afternoon chasing an undomesticated cat through long stalks of grass and weeds.Out of respect for the animals and concern for their health, they hope to keep the animals as undomesticated as possible.
